marketNews.title: Car Wholesales Sales -3% YoY in 4M25
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that national car wholesales in April 2025 reached 51,205 units (+5% YoY, -28% MoM). This result makes the cumulative wholesales sales for the first four months of 2025 (4M25) total 256,368 units (-3% YoY), which is roughly in line with expectations because it represents 28-34% of Gaikindo's 2025 target of 750,000-900,000 units (versus 4M24: 30% of the 2024 realization). The overall market also saw a solid growth in hybrid vehicle (HEV) sales, supporting Toyota sales. However, a significant increase in battery electric vehicle (BEV) sales caused the BEV segment to surpass HEV sales in 1Q25. The rapid growth of BEV sales is also reflected in BYD + Denza and Chery sales. As of April 2025, the market shares of BYD + Denza and Chery have risen to 8.4% and 3.2% respectively, up from around 2% recorded by both in December 2024. BYD's market share has made it the fourth largest brand in Indonesia in April 2025, even though it entered the Indonesian market only in mid-2024. The yearly comparison for April 2025 is also affected by the Lebaran seasonality effect. If only March and April 2025 sales are considered, total national car wholesales for those two months fell slightly by 1% YoY to 122,100 units. Although still declining, the weak sales condition is considered expected by the market.

marketNews.title: TOTL: Dividend Rp75 per Share, Contract Value +16% YoY in 4M25
marketNews.content: 1. $TOTL: Total Bangun Persada will distribute a 2024 fiscal year dividend of approximately 255.8 billion rupiah or 75 rupiah per share, corresponding to about 96% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 9.7% as of Thursday (15/5). The cum-date on the regular market and negotiation is May 23, 2025, with payment on June 18, 2025. In addition to the dividend, TOTL's Corporate Secretary Anggie S. Sidharta said on Thursday (15/5) that the company recorded new contract value of 2.15 trillion rupiah during 4M25 (+16.2% YoY), representing 43% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah. 2. $GOTO: Grab Indonesia's Chief of Public Affairs Tirza Munusamy stated on Thursday (15/5) that the company declines to comment on the rumored acquisition of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia, noting that the speculation is not based on verified information. 3. $MYOR: Mayora Indah plans a share buyback with a funding allocation of up to 1 trillion rupiah, although the company did not disclose the number of shares to be purchased. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on June 4, 2025, with the buyback period from June 5, 2025 to June 5, 2026. This corporate action is separate from the existing buyback, which is carried out without a shareholders meeting following OJK's relaxation to support market stability. The existing buyback, also allocating up to 1 trillion rupiah, is scheduled to be completed on May 28, 2025. 4. $ADRO: Alamtri Resources Indonesia announced that the share buyback period will be postponed, moving the RUPST date from May 15, 2025 to June 2, 2025. Consequently, the buyback with a funding allocation of up to 4 trillion rupiah will start on June 3, 2025 and run for 12 months. 5. $BBCA: Bank Central Asia announced that the company accelerates the end of its share buyback period from June 24, 2025 to May 15, 2025 (first trading session) due to stable market conditions and share price. Previously, BBCA announced a buyback with funding up to 1 trillion rupiah starting May 26, 2025. 6. $TINS: Timah's Director Nur Adi Kuncoro on Wednesday (14/5) requested DPR support to issue a legal basis for the company to act as the sole tin seller in Indonesia. He explained that such regulation would allow TINS to become a price maker, contributing more to state revenue. The DPR's Commission VI supports the issuance of a presidential regulation on critical and strategic minerals and related regulations granting TINS sole marketing authority. 7. $SGRO: Sampoerna Agro will distribute a 2024 fiscal year dividend of about 600 billion rupiah or 330 rupiah per share, corresponding to roughly 80% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 10.6% as of Thursday (15/5). The cum-date on the regular market and negotiation is May 21, 2025, with payment on June 5, 2025. 8. $TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific, through its joint venture with Glencore, Aster Chemicals and Energy, signed a cooperation agreement with Sembcorp Industries in the energy and utilities sector. Sembcorp will provide a complete suite of gas, electricity and utility solutions worth 650 million US dollars for Aster, which operates a refinery and chemical plant complex in Singapore. In addition to the commercial agreement, Sembcorp and Aster signed a memorandum of understanding for a six-month period to explore strategic initiatives in Singapore, Indonesia and the broader Southeast Asia region.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Should Know
marketNews.content:
1. Bloomberg reported that US and Chinese trade negotiators met in South Korea on Thursday (15/5), a few days after the two countries agreed to reduce each other's tariffs by 115 percentage points for a 90-day period. No further details were provided and the US Embassy in South Korea has not commented.
2. US President Donald Trump said on Thursday (15/5) that the United States is getting closer to reaching a nuclear deal with Iran to limit Iran's nuclear program. The statement came after Iran's top adviser Ali Shamkhani affirmed that Iran is willing to limit uranium enrichment if the US eases sanctions.
3. Bloomberg reported on Thursday (15/5) that Singapore health authorities recorded a Covid-19 case surge of +28% week-over-week to 14,200 cases during the week ending May 3, 2025, with daily hospitalizations rising about +30% week-over-week. The Ministry of Health noted that while the increase may be due to waning population immunity, there is no indication that circulating variants are more transmissible than during the pandemic.
4. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources announced that the Coal Reference Price (HBA) for the second half of May 2025 fell 8.2% month-over-month to USD 110.38 per ton, also 8.9% lower than the reference price for the first half of May 2025.
5. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government is opening the possibility to increase lithium imports from Australia for electric-vehicle battery projects, although the proposal remains tentative and depends on smelter needs in the Morowali Industrial Area, Central Sulawesi. The discussion was part of a meeting between President Prabowo Subianto and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on Thursday (15/5). Indonesia currently imports 70,000-80,000 tons of lithium per year from Australia.
6. Hillcon ($HILL) shareholder PT Hillcon Equity Management sold 56 million HILL shares at 296 rupiah per share on May 8, 2025. The total transaction value was 16.6 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Hillcon Equity Management's ownership in HILL decreased from 57.13% to 56.75%.
7. Panorama Sentrawisata ($PANR) shareholder PT Panorama Tirta Anugerah bought 9 million PANR shares at 750 rupiah per share on May 7, 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 6.8 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Panorama Tirta Anugerah's ownership in PANR increased from 44.25% to 44.9%.

tickerNews.title: Astra International (ASII) April 2025 Wholesales Sales Remain Flat YoY
tickerNews.content: Astra International ($ASII) recorded sales of 26,976 units in April 2025 (+0% YoY, -29% MoM), growing slower than the industry, causing ASII's market share to fall to 52.7% (vs. April 2024: 55.2%, March 2025: 53.2%). ASII's April wholesales were supported by Toyota + Lexus sales of 16,268 units (+5% YoY, -28% MoM), while Daihatsu sales dropped to 8,884 units (-6% YoY, -32% MoM). Cumulatively, ASII's wholesales for 4M25 declined to 137,788 units (-6% YoY), with market share decreasing to 53.7% (vs. 4M24: 55.5%).
